titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Photographs.001

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The photograph collection at Special Collections consists primarily of historical photographs of Virginia Tech, dating back to the 1890s. The collection is also home to historic images of Blacksburg, Montgomery County, the New River Valley, and Southwest Virginia in general. A photograph collection of faculty and staff from the university is maintained separately.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish images from the Historical Photograph Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [image], Historical Photograph Collection, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Historical Photograph Collection consists primarily of images donated or transferred to the University Libraries and/or the University Archives over time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The photograph collection at Special Collections consists primarily of historical photographs of Virginia Tech, dating back to the 1890s. Subjects include, but are not limited to: athletics, the Corps of Cadets, campus views and buildings, events and celebrations, Agricultural Extension sites/work, and candid images of students and campus groups. A alphabetically organized photograph collection of faculty and staff from the university is maintained separately.

The collection is also home to historic images of Blacksburg, Montgomery County, the New River Valley, and Southwest Virginia in general. Subjects include, but are not limited to: historic sites and buildings, Blacksburg views and buildings, scenes from surrounding towns/cities/counties, agriculture activities, and candid images of people.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by subject. Each subject listed has at least one photograph; some subjects have multiple folders.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p:
Faculty/Staff Photograph Collection
Individual Photograph Collections (usually named for the subject matter or collector)

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Agricultural extension work

Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. Corps of Cadets

did.unittitle: ADMINISTRATION BUILDING (OLD) (Housed administration offices from 1904 to 1936; also known as Rock House and Alwood House).
ALUMNI - PRESS PRINTS (Small prints of unidentified individual alumni)
ARCHITECTURE DEPT. - College of Architecture and Urban Studies
Athletics -- see SPORTS and/or specific name of sport
BAND (see also HIGHTY TIGHTIES, MARCHING VIRGINIANS, MUSIC)
Black Students -- see AFRICAN AMERICAN STUDENTS

odd.head: Note
odd.p: Poster-sized photographs of Blacksburg from this time period are available for viewing in Special Collections (Special Collections staff look in ART/Drawer 1 and Drawer 2).

did.unittitle: BUGLE - 1922 COLLECTION (Some of the photographs used in 1922 Bugle (the Virginia Tech student yearbook))
BUGLE - 1937 COLLECTION (Some of the photographs used in the 1937 Bugle (the Virginia Tech student yearbook))
BUGLE - 1959 COLLECTION (Some of the photographs used in the 1959 Bugle (the Virginia Tech student yearbook))
BUGLE - 1960 COLLECTION (Some of the photographs used in the 1960 Bugle (the Virginia Tech student yearbook))
BUILDINGS (see also names of specific building)
BUILDINGS - 1931 INSURANCE SURVEY PHOTOGRAPHS (Photographs taken of buildings in 1931 for insurance purposes. A list of the buildings can be found in the front of the folder.)
CAMPUS SCENES (includes people and activities; see also STUDENTS, CAMPUS WINTER SCENES)
CAMPUS VIEWS - NO DATES (includes buildings and physical environs)
CENTENNIAL ISSUE (MONTGOMERY NEWS MESSENGER) (Eleven photographs of other colleges used for a special edition of the Montgomery News Messenger.)
CLASSES AND CLASS REUNIONS (chronological by graduation year)
College of Education -- see EDUCATION, COLLEGE OF
Donaldson Brown CED -- see CONTINUING EDUCATION CENTER (CEC)
Equine Medical Center -- see MARION DUPONT SCOTT EQUINE MEDICAL CENTER
INDIVIDUALS (see also FACULTY and names of specific individuals and groups)
Johnston Hall -- see AMBLER JOHNSTON HALL
McBRYDE BUILDING (1914-66) (see also MECHANIC ARTS BUILDING)

odd.head: Note
odd.p: Oversize McCormick Farm photographs (on wood boards) and in boxes are available in Special Collections (Special Collections staff look on MR/3/A5 and in ART/Drawer 1).

did.unittitle: Major Williams Hall -- see WILLIAMS HALL
MARION DUPONT SCOTT EQUINE MEDICAL CENTER
MECHANIC ARTS BUILDING (see also McBRYDE BUILDING)
MUSIC (see also BAND, COLLEGIANS, GLEE CLUB, HIGHTY TIGHTIES, MARCHING VIRGINIANS)
NEWMAN LIBRARY (see also FRIENDS OF THE UNIVERSITY LIBRARIES, LIBRARY STAFF)
NORFOLK AND WESTERN RAILWAY (For more railroad photographs, see the Norfolk and Western Historical Photograph Collection.)
POLITICIANS (Includes Jim Turn, John Dalton, Bob Bradford, Governor Godwin, Fred Pollard, Linwood Holten, and Richard M. Nixon.)
Rector Field House -- see FIELD HOUSE (RECTOR)
Rectors, Board of Visitors -- see BOARD OF VISITORS
"ROCK, THE" (MEMORIAL) (see also WORLD WAR I MEMORIAL)
Virginia Water Resources Research Center -- see WATER RESOURCES RESEARCH CENTER
War Memorial Chapel -- see CHAPEL (WAR MEMORIAL)
WORKING - WORKERS AND WORK SITES - AT VIRGINIA TECH
WORLD WAR I MONUMENT (see also "ROCK, THE")
